title: Birth of James Beveridge Sr.
description: James Beveridge Sr. was born around 1700, likely in Scotland (family tradition places his birth in Dunfermline, Fife). He later migrated to Marblehead, Massachusetts and became the patriarch of the Beverage family.

title: Marriage of James Beveridge Sr. and Sarah Bennett
description: James Beveridge Sr. married Sarah Bennett at St. Michael's Church in Marblehead, Massachusetts. This was his first marriage.

title: Marriage of James Beveridge Sr. and Mary White
description: After the death of his first wife Sarah Bennett, James Beveridge Sr. married Mary White in Marblehead, Massachusetts.

title: Marriage of James Beveridge Sr. and Sarah Holman
description: James Beveridge Sr. married his third wife, Sarah Holman, in Marblehead, Massachusetts.

title: Birth of James Beveridge Jr.
description: James Beveridge Jr. was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts. He later settled on the Fox Islands (North Haven) and married Jean McKinney White.

title: Birth of Sarah Beveridge
description: Sarah Beveridge, daughter of James Beveridge Sr. and Sarah Bennett, was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts. She later married Peter Ayers.

title: Birth of Susannah Beveridge
description: Susannah Beveridge, daughter of James Beveridge Sr. and Mary White, was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts.

title: Birth of Jane Beveridge
description: Jane Beveridge, daughter of James Beveridge Sr. and Mary White, was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts.

title: Birth of Mary Beveridge
description: Mary Beveridge, daughter of James Beveridge Sr. and Mary White, was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts.

title: Marriage of James Beveridge Jr. and Jean McKinney White
description: James Beveridge Jr. married Jean (Jane) McKinney White, widow of Nicholas White, in Georgetown, Maine. This union linked the Beveridge and White families.

title: Birth of Capt. Thomas Beverage
description: Capt. Thomas Beverage (born Thomas Beveridge) was born at Mere’s Point, Topsham, Maine, in a stockaded house built by Capt. John Minot. He would later become a privateer and town clerk of North Haven.

title: Birth of Mercy Beveridge Henry
description: Mercy Beveridge Henry, daughter of James Beveridge Jr. and Jean McKinney White, was born. She later married Henry Henry.

title: Birth of Mercy Kent
description: Mercy Kent was born in Marshfield, Massachusetts. She married Capt. Thomas Beverage and settled on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Sarah Beveridge Kent
description: Sarah Beveridge Kent, daughter of James Beveridge Jr. and Jean McKinney White, was born. She later married Benjamin Kent, creating a double in-law tie between the Beveridge and Kent families.

title: Boston Tea Party participation
description: Family letters and deeds indicate that Capt. Thomas Beverage participated in the Boston Tea Party on 16 December 1773. He traveled from the Fox Islands to Marblehead and joined the group of patriots who destroyed tea in Boston Harbor.

title: Thomas sells 120 acres on North Fox Island
description: On 3 January 1774, Thomas Beveridge of Marblehead sold a 120-acre tract on North Fox Island to William Blackler for 53 pounds 13 shillings. The land bounded on William Perry’s land, a pond, Ezekiel Kent’s land and the thoroughfare.

title: Marriage of Thomas Beverage and Mercy Kent
description: Thomas Beverage married Mercy Kent at Trinity Church in Boston, Massachusetts. Mercy was the daughter of Ezekiel Kent and Susanna Bryant Winslow.

title: William Blackler reconveys land to Thomas
description: On 1 March 1779, William Blackler reconveyed the 120-acre tract on North Fox Island back to Thomas Beverage for £200. The land now measured 125 acres.

title: Birth of John White Beverage
description: John White Beverage, eldest son of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He was named after Mercy’s son by her first husband John White.

title: Birth of Nathaniel Winslow Beverage
description: Nathaniel Winslow Beverage, second son of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He later became a deacon in Camden.

title: Birth of Benjamin Kent Beverage
description: Benjamin Kent Beverage, third son of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He was named after his uncle Benjamin Kent.

title: Thomas Beverage testifies about Robert Duglase
description: In 1781, Thomas Beverage testified that Robert Duglase of Fox Island procured a pass from Capt. Henry Mowitt for fishing and bought a schooner from Billings Putnam of Newburyport. This testimony was recorded on 1 June 1786.
sources: Documentary History of the State of Maine

title: Fox Islands petition for land titles
description: In March 1785, the inhabitants of the Fox Islands Plantation met at the home of Benjamin Kent and Sarah Beveridge Kent to petition the Massachusetts General Court for clear title to lands occupied before 1 June 1784. James Beveridge Sr. was chosen moderator and Thomas Beverage was elected Plantation Clerk.

title: Birth of Mercy Kent Beverage
description: Mercy Kent Beverage, fourth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Sarah "Sally" Beverage
description: Sarah ("Sally") Beverage, fifth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. She later married Benjamin Kent.

title: Birth of Lydia Winslow Beverage (first)
description: Lydia Winslow Beverage, sixth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. She died young in 1792.

title: Birth of James Beverage
description: James Beverage, seventh child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He later became a tanner and landowner.

title: Birth of Josiah Winslow Beverage
description: Josiah Winslow Beverage, eighth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He later served as town selectman and co-owned the family mill.

title: Birth of Lydia Winslow Beverage (second)
description: Lydia Winslow Beverage, ninth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. She died in 1829.

title: Birth of Abigail Beverage
description: Abigail Beverage, tenth child of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. She died the following day.

title: Death of Abigail Beverage
description: Abigail Beverage, infant daughter of Thomas and Mercy Beverage, died the day after her birth on North Haven Island.

title: Thomas purchases 100 acres from Nathaniel Crockett Jr.
description: Thomas Beverage purchased 100 acres on North Haven from Nathaniel Crockett Jr. This land later formed part of the family estate. The deed was registered in 1806.

title: Thomas sells 120 acres to Samuel Thomas
description: On 3 November 1784, Thomas Beverage sold 120 acres of land on North Fox Island to Samuel Thomas for 150 pounds. The land later came into Kent and Beverage hands.

title: Witness to Woster land transaction
description: On 9 March 1781, Thomas Beverage and Abigail Dyer witnessed David Woster Sr. transferring half of his North Haven land to his infant son David Woster Jr. for $500. The transaction was recorded in 1801.
sources: Documentary History of the State of Maine

title: Settlement with Abel Whitman
description: On 21 May 1788, Thomas Beverage settled accounts with Abel Whitman, receiving payment in full for half of the island he had sold him.

title: Thomas Beverage registers his cattle mark
description: On 9 March 1789, Thomas Beverage registered his cattle mark in the town records: the left ear split and a half-penny out of the foreside of the right ear.

title: 1790 Census enumeration of the Beverage household
description: The 1790 U.S. Census recorded the household of Thomas Beverage on North Haven with two males over 16 (Thomas and John), four males under 16 (Nathaniel, Benjamin, James, Josiah) and five females (Mercy, Mercy Jr., Sarah, Lydia and an unknown female).

title: Witness to Heard land sale
description: On 10 October 1791, Thomas Beverage and William Cooper witnessed James and Elizabeth Heard selling Pulpit Harbor land for 90 pounds. The land was near Samuel Lewis’s property.

title: Witness to Eames Island sale
description: On 27 March 1792, Thomas Beverage and Levi Smith witnessed Charles Stewart and Abel Whitman selling Eames Island (40 acres) to John Brooks for 30 pounds.

title: Witness to Newbury land sale
description: On 6 April 1795, Thomas Beverage and his son Nathaniel Beverage witnessed Charles Stewart selling 38¾ acres to John Newbury.

title: Witness to Cooper land sale
description: On 20 May 1796, Thomas Beverage and Cornelius Bramhall witnessed Levi Smith selling 50 acres to Thomas Cooper for $250.

title: Thomas sells land to William Vinal
description: On 18 April 1797, Thomas Beverage sold a parcel of land near the North Harbor to William Vinal of Vinalhaven for $4. The deed was witnessed by Gabriel Johonnot and George Ulmer.

title: Witness to George White land sale
description: On 16 September 1800, Thomas Beverage and his son John White Beverage witnessed George White selling land by the Pond Swamp to Joseph Maddocks for $100.

title: Sale of mill shares to Henry Alexander
description: On 28 February 1806, Thomas Beverage sold Henry Alexander 1/8 share of the sawmill and 1/4 share of the grist mill for $300. The deed was witnessed by William Vinall and William Norwood.

title: Repurchase of land and mills from Henry Alexander
description: On 15 December 1807, Henry Alexander sold back to Thomas Beverage 115 acres, a dwelling house, barn, and shares in a sawmill and grist mill for $1500.

title: Robert Henry sells 100 acres to Oliver Amsbury
description: On 17 February 1808, Robert Henry of Topsham sold 100 acres on North Haven to Oliver Amsbury of Vinalhaven for $350, reserving 60 acres previously conveyed to David Perry. The deed was witnessed by Thomas Beverage and David Wooster Jr.

title: Thomas sells 115 acres to Josiah and James
description: On 11 May 1811, Thomas Beverage sold 115 acres, a dwelling house, barn, and shares in a sawmill and grist mill to his sons Josiah Winslow Beverage and James Beverage for $2,500.

title: Sale of 12 acres to Cornelius Bramhall
description: On 17 April 1813, Thomas Beverage sold 12 acres on the northeast cove of North Harbor to Cornelius Bramhall for $150. The deed was witnessed by Sarah and Sally Bramhall.

title: Sale of land to Malatiah Luce and Jonathan Smith
description: On 23 January 1814, Thomas Beverage sold land at the head of the Mill Pond to Malatiah Luce and Jonathan Smith for $150. The deed was witnessed by John Wagg and Nathaniel Beverage.

title: Thomas Beverage appointed delegate to Brunswick convention
description: In September 1816, Thomas Beverage was selected by the town to serve as delegate to the convention at Brunswick to discuss the separation of Maine from Massachusetts.

title: Death of Mercy Kent Beverage
description: Mercy Kent Beverage, wife of Capt. Thomas Beverage, died on North Haven Island.

title: Marriage of James Beverage and Jemima Crabtree
description: James Beverage married Jemima Crabtree on North Haven Island. Their union connected the Beverage family with the Crabtrees, another prominent island family.

title: Birth of Benjamin Crabtree Beverage
description: Benjamin Crabtree Beverage, eldest son of James Beverage and Jemima Crabtree, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Harrison Beverage
description: Harrison Beverage, second son of James and Jemima Beverage, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Albert Glover Beverage
description: Albert Glover Beverage, third son of James and Jemima Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. He later became a deacon and farmer.

title: Birth of Lucy C. Beverage
description: Lucy C. Beverage, only daughter of James and Jemima Beverage, was born on North Haven Island. She later died in 1850 after exposure to mercury in her father’s tannery.

title: Death of Capt. Thomas Beverage
description: Capt. Thomas Beverage died on North Haven Island. His grave is marked with a title recognizing his service during the Revolutionary War.

title: Death of Jemima Crabtree Beverage
description: Jemima Crabtree Beverage died on North Haven Island, likely from a hemorrhage linked to mercurial poisoning from the tannery.

title: Marriage of Benjamin Crabtree Beverage and Amelia Beverage
description: After his divorce from Sarah W. Loveland, Benjamin Crabtree Beverage married his second cousin Amelia Beverage on North Haven Island.

title: Death of James Beverage
description: James Beverage died on North Haven Island. His death, and that of his daughter Lucy two days later, were attributed to mercury poisoning from his tannery.

title: Death of Lucy C. Beverage
description: Lucy C. Beverage, daughter of James and Jemima Beverage, died two days after her father due to mercury poisoning from the tannery.

title: Death of Benjamin Kent Beverage
description: Benjamin Kent Beverage died on North Haven Island at age 72.

title: Death of Benjamin Crabtree Beverage
description: Benjamin Crabtree Beverage died during a diphtheria epidemic on North Haven Island. He was a deacon and farmer.

title: Marriage of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Margaret Leadbetter
description: Samuel Carver Beverage married Ruth Margaret Leadbetter in a double wedding on North Haven. Ruth’s brother Isaac Leadbetter married Jennie Sawyer at the same ceremony.

title: Birth of Hiram Stone Beverage
description: Hiram Stone Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island. He later operated the family farm at Sunnyside.

title: Birth of Albert Lewis Beverage
description: Albert Lewis Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Marston Leadbetter Beverage
description: Marston Leadbetter Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Olive Mary Beverage
description: Olive Mary Beverage, daughter of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Nettie Ellen Beverage
description: Nettie Ellen Beverage, daughter of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Elroy Victor Beverage
description: Elroy Victor Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of George Dewey Beverage
description: George Dewey Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Edith Etta Beverage
description: Edith Etta Beverage, daughter of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Wilson Freemont Beverage
description: Wilson Freemont Beverage, son of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Alma Marie Beverage
description: Alma Marie Beverage, daughter of Samuel Carver Beverage and Ruth Leadbetter, was born on North Haven Island. She died in infancy.

title: Birth of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage
description: Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage was born in Dorchester, Massachusetts. He later became a minister and father of Albion Pierson Beverage III.

title: Marriage of Orris Lyford Beverage and Rose Emma Pierson
description: Orris Lyford Beverage married Rose Emma Pierson at Tenants Harbor, Maine. Their marriage produced eight children.

title: Marriage of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage and Grace Elizabeth Reed
description: Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage married Grace Elizabeth Reed in Dorchester, Massachusetts. They later raised their family in Dresden, Maine.

title: Birth of Nancy Beverage
description: Nancy Beverage, daughter of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage and Grace Reed, was born. She later lived in Maine.

title: Birth of Grace Pauline Beverage
description: Grace Pauline Beverage, daughter of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage and Grace Reed, was born.

title: Birth of Albion Pierson Beverage III
description: Albion Pierson Beverage III, son of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage and Grace Elizabeth Reed, was born (approximate date). He later maintained the family cottage on North Haven.

title: Birth of Janice Lynn Marshall
description: Janice Lynn Marshall (later Beverage) was born around 1940. She married Albion Pierson Beverage III around 1962 and was the family genealogist.

title: Marriage of Hiram Stone Beverage and Ruby Hazel Taylor
description: Hiram Stone Beverage married Ruby Hazel Taylor around 1916 on North Haven Island. They had one son, Samuel Hiram Beverage.

title: Birth of Samuel Hiram Beverage
description: Samuel Hiram Beverage, only child of Hiram Stone Beverage and Ruby Hazel Taylor, was born at Sunnyside farm on North Haven Island.

title: Marriage of Samuel Hiram Beverage and Eleanor Mae Sargent
description: Samuel Hiram Beverage married Eleanor Mae Sargent in Somerville, Massachusetts in 1945. They raised five children and were instrumental in preserving North Haven history.

title: Death of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage
description: Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage died in Silver Spring, Maryland at age 43. He was buried in Fuller Cemetery on North Haven Island.

title: Death of Ruth Margaret Leadbetter Beverage
description: Ruth Margaret Leadbetter Beverage died on North Haven Island at age 92, having raised twelve children.

title: Death of Ruby Hazel Taylor Beverage
description: Ruby Hazel Taylor Beverage, wife of Hiram Stone Beverage and mother of Samuel Hiram Beverage, died on North Haven Island.

title: Birth of Robert Elliot Beverage
description: Robert Elliot Beverage, son of Albion Pierson Beverage III and Janice Marshall, was born (approximate date). He later married Heather Beverage and co-owns property on North Haven.

title: Marriage of Albion Pierson Beverage III and Janice Marshall
description: Albion Pierson Beverage III married Janice Lynn Marshall around 1962. They celebrated over 60 years of marriage and preserved the family cottage on North Haven.

title: Marriage of Robert Elliot Beverage and Heather Ellen Beverage
description: Robert Elliot Beverage married Heather Ellen Beverage (approximate date). They have three children: Lauren, Sarah and Daniel.

title: Purchase of 128 S Orchard Street, Wallingford
description: Robert Elliot Beverage and Heather Beverage purchased a home at 128 S Orchard Street in Wallingford, Connecticut, where they raised their family.

title: Founding of North Haven Historical Society
description: After returning permanently to North Haven in 1973, Samuel Hiram Beverage and his wife Eleanor helped found the North Haven Historical Society to preserve island history.

title: Sale of Old Barn Hill
description: In 1974, Arthur Walter Beverage Sr., a great-great-grandson of Capt. Thomas Beverage, sold Old Barn Hill to Henry Meigs. The hill was later developed as a private residence.

title: Death of Grace Elizabeth Reed Beverage
description: Grace Elizabeth Reed Beverage, widow of Rev. Albion Pierson Beverage, died in Dresden, Maine at age 99.

title: Death of Samuel Hiram Beverage
description: Samuel Hiram Beverage died on North Haven Island at age 97. He was a radio enthusiast, WWII veteran, and co-founder of the North Haven Historical Society.

title: Death of Janice Lynn Marshall Beverage
description: Janice Lynn Marshall Beverage died in Ocala, Florida after a long life dedicated to her family and genealogy research.

title: North Haven property record
description: The 2024 North Haven tax commitment list recorded Albion Pierson Beverage III and Robert E. Beverage as co-owners of parcel 13-004-D at 216 Beverage Colony Road, continuing the family’s land ownership on the island.
